snippet: Lago Enriquillo in the Dominican Republic, the largest lake in the Caribbean, has been rising and rising, devouring tens of thousands of acres of farmland, ranches and whatever else stands in its way.
abstract: Dominican Republic's Lago Enriquillo and neighboring Lac Azuei in Haiti are rising rapidly, flooding and submerging farms and ranches and displacing thousands of people; lakes have always had rising waters but never this large; cause is unknown, but consortium of scientists from United States and Dominican Republic are focusing on changing climate patterns as main culprit.

byline.contributor: Ezra Fieser contributed reporting from Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.

lead_paragraph: Lago Enriquillo in the Dominican Republic, the largest lake in the Caribbean, has been rising and rising, devouring tens of thousands of acres of farmland, ranches and whatever else stands in its way.

headline.main: Rising Tide Is a Mystery That Sinks Island Hopes
headline.print_headline: Rising Tide Is a Mystery That Sinks Island Hopes
